chunks.cleaned_english_translation: The Holy Spirit is also the creator, as is taught. In Job, we read: It is the divine Spirit who made me. In the psalm: Send out your spirit and they will be created. Psalm One Zero Four. In the Gospel: Mary was found to be with child from the Holy Spirit. To whom it was said: The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you. Matthew One. In the psalm: By the word of the Lord the heavens were made firm, and by the spirit of his mouth all their power. Psalm Thirty Three. If the Holy Spirit made the Son of God in the womb of the virgin, what is lacking to God that he did not create? In the Gospel: Unless one is born of water and the Holy Spirit, he cannot see the kingdom of God. It is greater to regenerate than to create: see, the Holy Spirit regenerates when we are reborn through him in baptism.
chunks.original_latin:
Quia et creator est Spiritus sanctus, sic docetur. In Job legimus: Spiritus divinus est qui fecit me. In
 psalmo: Emitte spiritum tuum et creabuntur (Psal CIII). In Evangelio: Inventa est Maria habens de Spiritu
sancto. Cui fuerat dictum: Spiritus sanctus superveniet
in te, et virtus Altissimi obumbrabit tibi (Matth I). In psalmo: Verbo Domini coeli firmati sunt, et Spiritu
oris ejus omnis virtus eorum (Psal XXXII). Si in
utero virginis Spiritus sanctus Filium Dei fecit, quid
Deo defuit quod non creavit? In Evangelio: Si quis
non renatus fuerit ex aqua et Spiritu sancto, non potest
videre regnum Dei. Amplius est enim regenerare
quam creare: ecce Spiritus sanctus regenerat, quando
in baptismo renascimur per ipsum.
